title: 820-3476 doesn't power on
message:
Hi,

This board is liquid damaged.

Corrosion around:
- JTAG(I already removed it).
- Backlight IC - removed
- U1900 - changed
- Q5480 - changed

I've green and orange light.

PPBUS_G3H - 12.57V
PP3V3_S5 - 3.3V
P5V1 - 5.1V
PP3V3_SUS - 0V

PM_RSMRST_L - 0V
PM_SYSRST_L - 0V

PPVRTC_G3H to PCH good.
Checked R1300/1/2/3 all seems good.

One weird thing I noticed.
U1900 PCH_CLK32K_RTCX1 goes extremly high around 3.3-3.6V.
I can see the wave form. However not that nice like on different boards.

I replaced SMC I thought that cause the PM_SYSRST_L not going high.
There is no short on this line. Dead PCH?

Thank you.

title: 820-3476 doesn't power on
message: Voltages on Y1905? I suspect a bad U1900, did you pull from donor?

title: 820-3476 doesn't power on
message:
Voltage on Y1905 is 1.16V for a millisecond. No oscillation.
U1900 was pulled from donor board. The original U1900 did the same thing after reflow.
The reason I changed it was this.

I can see the waveform on Y5110 for a sec, but nothing on Y1905.

title: 820-3476 doesn't power on
message: Is it outputting a steady 32kHz?

title: 820-3476 doesn't power on
message: Yes, it's steady 32kHz. I changed U1900 one more time from another donor board. Nothing changed.

title: 820-3476 doesn't power on
message: The fact that there is voltage on Y1905 means the machine is power cycling. The usual suspects apply: U6100 and resistors in the data lines, pin 8 U1950 corrosion? Picture of U6100 area would also help.

title: 820-3476 doesn't power on
message:
Well, voltage is there on Y1905 when first the power applied but just for one sec. After that nothing.
I believe if it would power cycling there should be voltage on it in every 1-2 sec.

Picture attached.

[url]https://c1.staticflickr.com/1/370/31399532990_90c68aaccf_o.jpg[/url]

title: 820-3476 doesn't power on
message:
No corrosion around U1950. Pin 8 also looks ok. PP3V42_G3H is there.

[URL="https://c1.staticflickr.com/1/746/30930815804_ef96f0bd17_o.jpg"]https://c1.staticflickr.com/1/746/30...96f0bd17_o.jpg[/URL]

I know you can't see pin 8 on this picture but you can see that the area around U1950 is really clean.

title: 820-3476 doesn't power on
message: U6100 area picture?

message:
[QUOTE="bighead, post: 11683"]Well, voltage is there on Y1905 when first the power applied but just for one sec. After that nothing.
I believe if it would power cycling there should be voltage on it in every 1-2 sec.

title: 820-3476 doesn't power on
message: The bios is not original. Someone replaced that.

title: 820-3476 doesn't power on
message: You must have better eyes than me! Must be really good at this!

title: 820-3476 doesn't power on
message: I see some crummy resistors around the SMC. Soldering on U1900 looks a bit crappy too.....Must be more corrosion somewhere else.

title: 820-3476 doesn't power on
message:
I'm going to change those resistors. I took some pictures of U1900 after I cleaned the flux.
I hope you just saw it creepy because of the flux.

[url]https://c2.staticflickr.com/6/5576/31775835905_785d7ad021_k.jpg[/url]
[url]https://c1.staticflickr.com/1/451/30934607354_e8cc2d6a56_k.jpg[/url]

There is still flux on the chip. After the success repair I always put it in the UC cleaner.
I usually don't worry about it while I'm fixing the board.

title: 820-3476 doesn't power on
message:
Bad looking resistors are replaced around SMC. No change.
Should I pull the SMC and try another one?

Only corrosion was around those components I mentioned in my first post.

title: 820-3476 doesn't power on
message: Pull SMC and try another one. But before you put the new SMC on pull U6100 and measure all pins on diode mode. Then after you put SMC on measure them again, then put U6100 back. Note all the values.

title: 820-3476 doesn't power on
message:
Without and with SMC the numbers are almost the same.

U6100:
Without SMC

Pin 1 0.455
Pin 2 0.455
Pin 3 1.1
Pin 4 0
Pin 5 0.469
Pin 6 0.467
Pin 7 0.438
Pin 8 0.392

With SMC

Pin 1 0.452
Pin 2 0.452
Pin 3 1.1
Pin 4 0
Pin 5 0.467
Pin 6 0.464
Pin 7 0.436
Pin 8 0.390

The same problem with another SMC from the same donor board.

title: 820-3476 doesn't power on
message: This board does not cycle on-off even without bios. I'm sure something else wrong with it.

title: 820-3476 doesn't power on
message: Your multimeter is too slow to catch the cycling. Check with a scope if you want to be sure.

title: 820-3476 doesn't power on
message:
I know it's hard to catch with multimeter. There is nothing neither on the scope.
There is something on Y1905 for a sec when I first attach the adapter, but that's it.

title: 820-3476 doesn't power on
message: No pulse on L7520? 3V present on L7560?
